H0.text: What are the tetrahedron, cube, octahedron, dodecahedron and icosahedron known as. Polyhedra

H1.text: What are the tetrahedron, cube, octahedron, dodecahedron and icosahedron known as. Geometric Shapes

H2.text: What are the tetrahedron, cube, octahedron, dodecahedron and icosahedron known as. Platonic Solids

H3.text: What are the tetrahedron, cube, octahedron, dodecahedron and icosahedron known as. Regular solid

A4.text: There are only five such polyhedra: a tetrahedron (four triangular faces), a cube (six square faces), an octahedron (eight triangular faces), a dodecahedron (twelve pentagonal faces), and an icosahedron (twenty triangular faces).

A5.text: Being a regular polyhedron means that the faces are congruent regular polygons and the same number of faces meet at each vertex.

A6.text: There are five convex regular polyhedra (the Platonic solids).

A7.text: The regular polyhedra are the most symmetrical of all the polyhedra.
